title: The best blood-red wines to pour for Hallowe'en
text:
I have done my bit when it comes to “trick or treat” at Hallowe’en, escorting excited children in witches’ hats from door to door in the cold, while trying to stop them eating hundreds of sweets in one go. Now they’re too old to be seen dead doing that, we’re throwing a Hallowe’en party for neighbours, and deciding what grown-ups would like to drink instead.

We could have some fun punning with the names of wines, perhaps chilling whites from Bordeaux’s Graves region and uncorking reds from Burgundy’s Beaune… but, honestly, who is going to stop and look at the labels and get the (poor) joke? Expensive regions, too…

If anyone wants a devilish name, Chile’s Casillero del Diablo range, both reds...
